bio.experienceSummary:
As a former teacher/assistant at a daycare center I believe about acknowledging the importance of connecting with children, having a set daily routine and being consistent can make a positive impact in their lives. 

If I could describe myself in a few words I would say that I am extremely charismatic and caring about what I do. My warm and approachable personality allow me to easily connect with kids and build strong relationships. I am a great listener and I am exceptionally comfortable with enforcing household rules, and having open communication with parents. 

I enjoy educational games that promote learning and critical thinking like any type of puzzle that will engage and entertain children. I also enjoy taking neighborhood walks, or playing with children at the park when weather permits. 

I can provide Early Childhood Education (ECE) coursework, Child Development Associate (CDA) certification, and training in First Aid and CPR, and references upon request!

I'm a medical student at Mount Sinai, specializing in Ob/Gyn. Beyond helping raise my three younger siblings, I babysat throughout high school and tutored children in college. I hope to never need these skills on a job, but I am CPR certified and have lots of experience with first aid, adult and pediatric health emergencies, and minor pediatric concerns from my time in clinic.

Outside of my studies, I'm passionate about cooking, gardening, and picking up new crafting hobbies, like candle making and weaving :) 

I'd describe my personality as responsible, compassionate, and fun! 

My best childcare skills include being patient and empathetic, being silly and entertaining, and being efficient and calm during emergencies. I am also good at changing diapers, feeding babies, and first aid!

Hello! I'm a versatile caregiver with a background in Public Health and a 4-year history in policy advocacy. I recently ventured into software engineering through a year-long boot camp, and now, in the midst of this transformative career juncture, I'm excited about dedicating my energy to childcare. 

My journey began in high school, providing care during church events. Later, I excelled as a substitute teacher in Montessori preschools, fostering independence and effective communication. Additionally, I have experience as a dedicated nanny for a 4-year-old and 12-year-old. I'm genuinely excited about the prospect of becoming a part of your family's journey. Understanding the significance of a nurturing environment, I'm committed to fostering it. Whether it's inspiring imaginative play, aiding with school tasks, or simply sharing heartwarming moments, I'm eager to make a positive impact in your children's lives. 

Thank you for considering me to work with your family.

I'm Maggie! I am currently studying at NYU full time in cinema studies! I have a wide range of experience with all age groups. I am a big fan of caring for the family I am providing for as a whole, not only helping the children but additionally helping every family member with whatever they need. I look forward to meeting some of you!

Hi Parents!

My name is Christae & 
I'm a longtime babysitter/nanny/children's entertainer for multiple families in the NYC community & am seeking a part-time morning childcare position 
I would love to work as many hours as possible, but am looking for at least 20 hours/week & am flexible on the end time. 

I hold a BFA in musical theatre performance, am a facepainter/balloon twister plus CPR/First Aid certified/Stop the Bleed certified, and have 20+ years of childcare experience. 
My Childcare Resume can be sent upon request! 

I'm available to provide background check details etc as well. 

Please let me know if I am a fit for you!

Feel free to message me here!

Thank you! 

Warmly,
Christae

description.displayText:
Absolutely loved having Christae as a nanny to our 15 month old daughter. We adored her instantly and her calm, nurturing nature made us all feel comfortable. Christae always found ways to entertain our daughter who is very busy and has a short attention span, we were very impressed. She was also very focused on the health and well-being of our child and would only spend time with other kids or go outside if she felt it was in the best interest of our daughter. When our little one would fuss, Christae showed endless amounts of patience and she was also very respectful of my husband and I working from home. 

If you are lucky enough to hire Christae, you will experience her warmth from day 1. I hope she finds a family as wonderful as she is. We would have continued to have Christae as part of our family if we weren't leaving the city. We already miss her.

bio.experienceSummary:
I have 17 years of experience as a childcare provider. I worked with different age groups (0-12). I have an affinity for working with children. I enjoy seeing them grow and develop their own characters while feeling loved and taken care of. My primary focus is on helping the children figure out their talents and strengths and working towards helping then reach their full potenial. 
I'm trustworthy and reliable.

description.displayText: Neveen has been a total life saver for our family. She's essentially a Mary Poppins! As a working mom of two young children (ages 1 and 3) - I have little spare time to think of ways to make our days more streamlined and Neveen has somehow magically improved many inefficiencies in our home. She draws on her diverse professional background to offer and implement great ideas in regards to raising our kids. My kids thrive in her presence and I am completely at ease when she is with them, which is the most important thing. Neveen is a total package gem and I hope it comes across that I am shouting a "5 star +" review.

bio.experienceSummary: I am a certified literacy and math tutor and confident child care provider most frequently for kids ranging from PreK-5th. In 2022, I graduated from USC with a BA in Psychology and a minor in Education. I have worked in a multitude of diverse settings with youth for over 8 years as an infant babysitter, nanny, dance teacher, after school program coordinator, tutoring site director, and art camp counselor. My most recent work situated me as an early childhood educator at a nature-based preschool program on Kauai. I simultaneously worked with homeschooled children (ages 5-8) leading enriching curriculum including outdoor explorations and farm adventure days. I find immense joy in working with children and have recently relocated to Brooklyn as I pursue a PsyD within a Child Psychology program. I am a skilled communicator, engaged caregiver, and a versatile individual. I also excel with organizational and cleaning tasks. I look forward to potentially supporting your family.

description.originalText: Nisey is wonderful! Stop your search now because you’ve found a wonderful caregiver 🤍 She helped watch our 1 year old boy several times. We wish we would have met her sooner and would have loved to hire Nisey many more times before she relocated. She was attentive, caring, on time, responsive, reliable and all around a pleasure to be around. Our boy is tricky with separation and has a strong willed personality, Nisey made me feel at ease while he was in her care.

bio.experienceSummary:
I am 30 years old and I love working with kids of all ages! I graduated from Hunter College in 2016 and live on the Upper East Side. I have been babysitting/nannying either full time or part time since 2013. I worked as a full-time nanny during the pandemic as well. I keep in touch with all 15+ families (over 30 kids!) that I have worked for through the years!
 
I have worked with every single age from newborn to 12 years old, including babies/kids with autism, speech delays, and genetic disorders. I have also helped families navigate through divorces, fertility issues, surrogacies and adoptions. I am happy to answer any questions you may have about my experience.

I was born and raised in NYC and love it! This has definitely made me a "city kid" who can navigate the subway and bus system as well as the city with ease.

description.originalText: Marlene is an INCREDIBLE caretaker - much more than a babysitter. She has helped us consistently take care of our two kids, ages 4 and 1, but I'm sure we would be great with any ages. She is beyond trustworthy and caring, and handles every aspect of scheduling, feeding, naptime, and playtime. Mostly, what we love about her is that she seems to genuinely enjoy spending time with children and getting to know what's fun for our kids. She is flexible and easy to communicate with. I can't recommend her enough!

bio.experienceSummary:
About Me
Hi! My name is Stefani, and I'm passionate about providing reliable, compassionate care for families and individuals. With my experience in organization, communication, and creating positive environments, I aim to bring both professionalism and warmth to the services I provide.

I pride myself on being attentive to the needs of others and creating a safe, supportive atmosphere for everyone I work with. Whether you're looking for help with childcare, pet care, or household support, I'm here to make your life easier and more manageable.

When I'm not working, I enjoy being creative, traveling, and building meaningful connections. I'm organized, trustworthy, and committed to making a positive impact in your home.

Feel free to reach out if you'd like to learn more about me I look forward to meeting you!

description.displayText: Fun, playful, and super creative. She always did arts and crafts with my kids and got them out of the house!
description.originalText: Fun, playful, and super creative. She always did arts and crafts with my kids and got them out of the house!

bio.experienceSummary: Hello!! I have 7+ years of experience with babysitting. I have cleaned, cook, help with homework, and put kids to sleep. I grew up taking care of my siblings, I have a lot of patience and enthusiasm taking care of kids. I'm willing to help them with homework, do crafts, and even have a movie night. I don't have children of my own, but I do have a god son that's almost 2 years old.

description.originalText:
I cannot express how grateful I am to have Evelyn as our nanny! From the moment she stepped into our home, it was clear that she possesses a natural gift for childcare. Her warmth, patience, and genuine love for children shine through in everything she does. 
I wholeheartedly recommend Evelyn to any family looking for a caring dedicated and trustworthy nanny. She has become an invaluable part of our family and we feel so fortunate to have her in our lives.
